reviews.review_msg: knows the information extremely well, but conveys it in such a monotone voice it makes it so difficult not to sleep. spent too much time on pre 1900 and dont do it if you like battles of ww1/2 cause its not in here. if you're a hist mjr and considering this class i would tell you to look elsewhere

Half way through the semester and so far so good. I wish we'd stay the whole time, though. Sometimes I wonder if he's a communist, but it takes all kinds to stimulate discussion. He's very approachable and knowledgeable.

What a character! Tests are easy bc the terms he gives you essentially are the test. VERY prone to going on LONNNG tangents. You never need to do readings for the Islamic Civ course tutorial bc it's all group discussions in small groups he doesn't supervise. In fact half the time he leaves the room. Very involved in Islamic studies conferences.

Okay,now let's be fair to Jack. I took Friday MORNING seminar with him and managed to get through without falling asleep once. Dr. Little made himself totally available to giving us help on our term papers, so I think it's fair he marks a bit hard. This guy knows his stuff, just don't expect him to be Will Ferrell or something, and you'll do fine.
Fair marker, really tries hard to use humour in lectures which makes them really enjoyable. Highly recommend him!!!

You gotta love Janice! She's bitterly sarcastic in the best way, her dry sense of humour came in handy during WWII in Japan class. She really knows her stuff and seems to like teaching. If I was going to do a Masters she would be one of the two people I'd consider asking to be my supervisor. I really like her teaching style
